page.title: 02Local Government And Ecology
page.content: {There are three councils,Suffolk County Council,Suffolk Coastal District Council and Felixstowe Town Council. This year Mr Mumford is the Mayor. Landguard is the most southern part of Felixstowe. Near the Common the soil is very sandy with pebbles. When rain falls it quickly drains away.In these conditions we find Vipers Bugloss,Sea Holly, Sea Campion, Sea Pea, Yellow Horned Poppy, Marram Grass and banks of tamarisk where butterflies like Skippers,Holly Blue and Wall Brown can be watched on summer days. The birds seen at Landguard include whitethroats, blackcap,garden warblers,nightingales, redstarts and meadow pippets. Little Terns nest on the beach. The Suffolk Trust for Nature Conservation has converted an army lookout to a bird- watching hide.Felixstowe Information Bureau can give the Warden's address.
